snippet: Nollywood is resonating across the continent with its stories of a pre-colonial past and of a present caught between village life and urban modernity.
abstract: Nigeria's flourishing movie industry, known as Nollywood, is exploding across Africa as cultural phenomenon; Nollywood makes 2,500 movies annually, second-biggest producer after India's Bollywood; its stories of a pre-colonial past and of a present caught between village life and urban modernity resonate for many.
lead_paragraph: Nollywood is resonating across the continent with its stories of a pre-colonial past and of a present caught between village life and urban modernity.

headline.main: Nigeria’s Booming Film Industry Redefines African Life
headline.print_headline: Nollywood Is Letting Africans Put Themselves in the Picture
